meanings.definition: To rise up or stand up.
meanings.sent1: The cat will uprise from its nap when it hears the sound of food.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, the sun will uprise in the east.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy bear tried to uprise from its cozy den but decided to snooze a bit longer.
meanings.sent4: The hot air balloon began to uprise slowly into the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The flowers uprise from the ground in the spring, reaching for the warm sun above.

meanings.definition: To increase in amount or level.
meanings.sent1: With hard work, her grades started to uprise steadily throughout the school year.
meanings.sent2: The excitement in the room began to uprise as the concert drew closer.
meanings.sent3: The laughter from the joke made everyone's spirits uprise in joy.
meanings.sent4: The cheers from the crowd seemed to uprise like a wave, filling the stadium.
meanings.sent5: The price of the rare toy started to uprise quickly as collectors sought it out.

meanings.sent1: The uprise of laughter in the classroom caught the teacher by surprise.
meanings.sent2: The uprise of protests in the city led to changes in government policies.
meanings.sent3: The uprise of giggles during the serious meeting lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: The uprise of excitement in the air signaled the start of the festival.
meanings.sent5: The uprise of cheers from the fans echoed through the stadium after the winning goal.
